intro: Thapsandra cretica, commonly known as the Cretan thapsandra, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, pungent odor. Thapsandra cretica is often found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
